per_query.query: does creatine help beginners gain strength

baseline.text:
Beginner mode: I'll keep the explanation simple.


Creatine supplementation provides additional strength and muscle growth benefits even in trained individuals following a structured resistance program... [1]

Creatine monohydrate has become a popular ergogenic aid due to its effects on strength and lean body mass. However, some concerns remain about potential long-term adverse effects... [2]

In healthy resistance-trained adults, one year of creatine supplementation did not adversely affect kidney function... [3]

citations.citation: Garcia L, Thompson R (2020). Effects of creatine on strength and hypertrophy in trained men. Strength and Conditioning Research. DOI: 10.2345/creatine.strength.2020
Smith J, Lee K (2018). Long-term safety of creatine supplementation. Journal of Sports Nutrition. DOI: 10.1234/creatine.safe.2018
Brown D, Ahmed Z (2021). Renal function in resistance-trained individuals using creatine. Clinical Exercise Physiology. DOI: 10.5678/creatine.kidney.2021

per_query.query: effect of high-frequency training on muscle growth in trained lifters

baseline.text:
Intermediate mode: Using more technical language.


Creatine has been repeatedly shown to increase high-intensity exercise capacity, but its impact in already trained lifters remains an area of interest... [1]

Short-term creatine loading enhanced repeated-sprint performance in team-sport athletes, supporting its use in high-intensity intermittent sports... [2]

In healthy resistance-trained adults, one year of creatine supplementation did not adversely affect kidney function... [3]

citations.citation: Garcia L, Thompson R (2020). Effects of creatine on strength and hypertrophy in trained men. Strength and Conditioning Research. DOI: 10.2345/creatine.strength.2020
O'Connor P, Silva R (2017). Impact of creatine on sprint performance in team-sport athletes. International Journal of Sports Performance. DOI: 10.4567/creatine.sprint.2017
Brown D, Ahmed Z (2021). Renal function in resistance-trained individuals using creatine. Clinical Exercise Physiology. DOI: 10.5678/creatine.kidney.2021

baseline.text:
Intermediate mode: Using more technical language.


Repeated sprints are a key component of many field-based sports. Creatine may improve performance by increasing phosphocreatine availability... [1]

Creatine has been repeatedly shown to increase high-intensity exercise capacity, but its impact in already trained lifters remains an area of interest... [2]

Serum creatinine increased slightly as expected, but estimated GFR and other kidney markers remained within normal limits and were not different from controls... [3]
